alert.note: Alert for Banner; Box Butte; Cheyenne; Dawes; Kimball; Morrill; North Sioux; Scotts Bluff; South Sioux (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 31 at 9:22PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Box Butte, eastern Scotts Bluff, northwestern Cheyenne, northeastern Kimball, Morrill, eastern Banner, southern Dawes and southeastern Sioux Counties through 915 PM MDT... At 821 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Redington, or 24 miles southeast of Scottsbluff, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Torrential rainfall, winds in excess of 40 mph, and half inch hail. Minor urban and residential flooding is possible as well. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Scottsbluff, Alliance, Sidney, Kimball, Gering, Bridgeport, Bayard, Terrytown, Crawford, Minatare, Hemingford, Potter, Dalton, Dix, Gurley, Brownson, Northport, Box Butte Dam, Berea and Flahertys Corner. This includes Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 15 and 52. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Banner; Box Butte; Cheyenne; Dawes; Kimball; Morrill; North Sioux; Scotts Bluff; South Sioux
